    • Method Detail

      • getTempDir

        public Path getTempDir()
        Temp folder location.

      • getStartupCommand

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<String> getStartupCommand()
        Command that is used to start the worker job, e.g. "my_hashing_tool". It is expected that this tool will be able to act as a worker process (communicate using specific protocol, accept jobs, etc.)

      • getStartupArgs

        public String getStartupArgs()
        All args combined into single string and separated with a white space, e.g. if tool is expected to compute hashes on the fly you may pass something like "--compute-hashes". This string will be escaped for you using Escaper#SHELL_ESCAPER.

      • getStartupEnvironment

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<String,String> getStartupEnvironment()
        Environment that will be used to start the worker tool.

      • getJobArgs

        public String getJobArgs()
        The arguments of the actual job once tool has started and ready to accept jobs. For example, "--hash-file /path/to/file".

      • getMaxWorkers

        public int getMaxWorkers()
        Maximum number of tools that pool can have.

      • getPersistentWorkerKey

        public Optional<String> getPersistentWorkerKey()
        If this value is set, it will be used to obtain the instance of the worker process pool. If the value is absent, then key is computed based on the startup command and startup arguments.

      • getWorkerHash

        public Optional<com.google.common.hash.HashCode> getWorkerHash()
        Hash to identify the specific worker pool and kind of a mechanism for invalidating existing pools. If this value for the given persistent worker key changes, old pool will be destroyed and the new pool will be recreated.
